name: The Avalon Hotel and Conference Center

reviews.text: While in town visiting family I stayed at the Avalon. I was worried after reading some of the reviews, but I was very impressed with the hotel. The large rooms were very nice and comfortable. The staff was also very polite and attentive. I would certainly recommend staying here to anyone visiting the area.
reviews.title: Wonderful place to stay!
No complaints...... well, just one!
reviews.text: I was really worried about staying here after reading all the negative reviews. I dont know what all these people were talking about..... the hotel was great!! Maybe a little out dated but it was very clean. Our room was nice. Beds were comfy. Nice fluffy and full pillows. Great selection of channels on the tv. Went to the restaurant one night for dinner. My mom and I both enjoyed our dinners very much. Our only complaint was the included breakfast. Everything was satisfactory or non-edible. I would definitely stay here again.

Were the hallways stained, discolored and not quite bright enough? Yes, they were. That said, there was very little else to complain of . The things that were important -- room, service, reception area, meeting rooms -- were just fine and available at a terrific price. Staff was unfailingly polite and helpful. The room was clean and had the usual modern conveniences -- WiFi, coffee, plenty of space. All in all, a great value and an enjoyable stay
reviews.title: Yes, the halls were dingy, but the rest was very good

reviews.text: This was our second visit to the Avalon. We were very happy with the Hotel, the staff is amazing and the meals were flawless. We stayed a week and have zero complaints about our room or housekeeping. Our only concern was that the bar was not open as often as we'd like, but there are plenty of quality clubs a short walk away.
reviews.title: Another GREAT GALA

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at this hotel on Monday evening, Nov. 1st, after having made a reservation directly with the the hotel the prior afternoon. This was our first visit to the Avalon and we chose this property based on location, as were travling through the area on our way home to Ohio.
reviews.title: Great Hotel Value!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I think it was a very nice place 20 years ago. They've kept up the lobby and ballroom/conference facilities which seem to be their main business. If you only came to an event here, you'd think the rest of the hotel was probably pretty nice. Unfortunately as soon as you get in the elevator you realize they've let the place get run down. Upstairs hallways are missing baseboards. Stains on carpet cannot be ignored. Same thing in the rooms. The bathrooms really need to be updated. The sheets are dingy and stained. Not that it was dirty, it just felt that way. It was NOT a relaxing place to stay. Seems to cater to guests who are in town for party scene and can get a little loud at night. Bottom line is that there are several places in Erie that are much nicer for the same price. Its not a city where you have to stay downtown, so its really not worth it.
reviews.title: Stains on carpet and sheets says it all
Needs updating
reviews.text: Lobby was nice, rest of hotel was dumpy. The elevator shook and the bathroom was dirty. No decor what so ever. Ruggs were dirty. Never saw a hotel with windows that opened. Very little lighting. Hotel restaurant=BAD!!

First and foremost, the hotel is old. There is no hiding that fact. That said, there were many other issues with the Avalon. The entire building, whether non-smoking or not, smelled horribly of smoke. The carpets were stained all over and the floors vibrated due to some sort of disturbance in the heating system. The elevators smelled of rotten fish for some odd reason, and the beds were quite hard. The "King Suite" was NOT as it was shown on the website; it was run down and junky.
reviews.title: Old and Junky. Not for Leisure traveling, but may serve well for Business Travelers.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the plus side, the rooms were very roomy for standard sized ones. Service was very friendly and helpful, and you can't find a better location. Located in the heart of Erie right b all the shopping, nightlife, and Gannon University.
reviews.title: Old Hotel gets a bad rap! We were pleased!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, while I would not recommend this hotel to a friend for leisure purposes, it served its purpose for an overnight stay to a business meeting and I would reccomend it to the business traveler on a budget.
reviews.title: great place to stay

reviews.text: The lobby is kinda nice but that ends there... The carpet has stains the shower is moldy. The beds are hard. There are parties 3/3 nights I've been here...
reviews.title: I wish I could post pics... DONT COME HERE

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Reading past reviews of this hotel, I was scared and thought I would be walking into the Bates motel.....but this was not the case. The front desk was very helpful and friendly. I was thinking "hey, if the rooms are anything like this nice lobby, it's all good." Unfortunately the room was not quite like the lobby, but it was sufficient. The sheets, towels, floor and bathroom were clean. There were no roaches or other insects running around. The only bad thing...our room was super hot. We set it to 40 degrees, left and went to a wedding, and when we came back it still felt like the devil was chilling in our room. But since it was a cool night, my boyfriend was able to open the window and life was good. It was also convenient since the event was in the Presque Isle ballroom (which is beautiful!). We were able to walk to all the bars on State Street with ease. Sure this place is no 4 star hotel, but it is not THAT bad. I think with some updates, this hotel will be worth its daily price. If I had another overnight event and needed someplace to crash, sure I would stay again.
reviews.title: Not as bad as it's made out to be...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sure, the hotel is old and outdated, but I agree with the post below. I too was leery after reading the reviews, but other than old age and dilapidation, the hotel was fine. "Old age" and "dirty" do not mean the same thing, and should not be interpreted as such. Our room was very clean, as was our bedding, towels, etc. The bed was comfortable, and the only reason sleeping was somewhat uncomfortable was because the room was a little warm. The front desk staff was very helpful and accommodating. I think with a little TLC this could be restored back to a wonderful hotel. Would I stay here again? Well, it wouldn't be my first choice because I do feel it was overpriced. But if I was in town for a night or two, I would give it another go. Definitely not as bad as I expected after visiting this site.
reviews.title: Pleasantly Surprised

description: The Avalon Hotel is, without exception, a luxurious conference quality hotel. Located in the heart of downtown Erie, our exquisite ballrooms & smaller private rooms will accommodate 20 to 1000 for showers, concerts, receptions, conventions, meetings & much more! Whether you are looking for a modern traditional wedding, daily meetings with custom menus or overnight accommodations the Avalon is the place to be.
